class.name: SentryLogger
class.description:
A dedicated API for logging messages to Sentry's structured logging system. Access this API through [member SentrySDK.logger]. [SentryLogger] provides methods for different log levels ([method trace], [method debug], [method info], [method warn], [method error], [method fatal]) and enables structured data capture with your log messages. [b]Note:[/b] The [member SentryExperimental.enable_logs] option in [member SentryOptions.experimental] must be enabled for logging functionality to work. [codeblock] # Simple messages SentrySDK.logger.info("Game session started") SentrySDK.logger.error("Asset loading failed")
# Messages with parameters (uses Godot's format strings) SentrySDK.logger.info("Spawned %d enemies in level %s", [5, "forest_1"]) SentrySDK.logger.error("Failed to load texture: %s", ["player_sprite.png"]) SentrySDK.logger.warn("Player %s has %d health remaining", ["Alice", 75])
# Messages with structured attributes SentrySDK.logger.warn("Performance warning", [], { "fps": 30, "target_fps": 60 }) SentrySDK.logger.debug("Player action", [], { "player_id": "p123", "action": "attack" })
# Using the base log method with different levels SentrySDK.logger.log(SentryLog.LOG_LEVEL_TRACE, "AI state transition") [/codeblock] Structured attributes support [code]bool[/code], [code]int[/code], [code]float[/code], and [code]String[/code] data types. Other types will be converted to strings. To learn more about logs in Sentry, check out the [url=https://docs.sentry.io/product/explore/logs/]Sentry Logs[/url] product guide.

method.name: debug
method.description:
Logs a debug message to Sentry. The [param body] is the main log message and can contain format placeholders (e.g., [code]%s[/code], [code]%d[/code]) for use with [param parameters]. The optional [param parameters] array provides positional values to substitute into placeholders using Godot's format strings. The optional [param attributes] dictionary adds structured metadata to the log entry. Structured attributes support [code]bool[/code], [code]int[/code], [code]float[/code], and [code]String[/code] data types. Other types will be converted to strings. [codeblock] # Simple usage SentrySDK.logger.debug("Spawning enemies with 5 units")
# With parameters and attributes SentrySDK.logger.debug("Spawning %s with %d units", ["enemies", 5], { "level": "forest_1", "wave_id": "wave_3" }) [/codeblock]

method.name: error
method.description:
Logs an error message to Sentry. The [param body] is the main log message and can contain format placeholders (e.g., [code]%s[/code], [code]%d[/code]) for use with [param parameters]. The optional [param parameters] array provides positional values to substitute into placeholders using Godot's format strings. The optional [param attributes] dictionary adds structured metadata to the log entry. Structured attributes support [code]bool[/code], [code]int[/code], [code]float[/code], and [code]String[/code] data types. Other types will be converted to strings. [codeblock] # Simple usage SentrySDK.logger.error("Failed to load save file after 3 attempts")
# With parameters and attributes SentrySDK.logger.error("Failed to load %s after %d attempts", ["save file", 3], { "error_code": "FILE_CORRUPT", "file_path": "saves/player1.save" }) [/codeblock]

method.name: fatal
method.description:
Logs a fatal message to Sentry. Fatal logs indicate critical errors that may cause the application to crash or become unusable. The [param body] is the main log message and can contain format placeholders (e.g., [code]%s[/code], [code]%d[/code]) for use with [param parameters]. The optional [param parameters] array provides values to substitute into placeholders using Godot's format strings. The optional [param attributes] dictionary adds structured metadata to the log entry. Structured attributes support [code]bool[/code], [code]int[/code], [code]float[/code], and [code]String[/code] data types. Other types will be converted to strings. [codeblock] # Simple usage SentrySDK.logger.fatal("Save data corrupted: 15 checksums failed in player_profile")
# With parameters and attributes SentrySDK.logger.fatal("Save data corrupted: %d checksums failed in %s", [15, "player_profile"], { "corrupted_files": 3, "backup_available": false }) [/codeblock]

method.name: info
method.description:
Logs an informational message to Sentry. Info logs are used for general application flow and important events. The [param body] is the main log message and can contain format placeholders (e.g., [code]%s[/code], [code]%d[/code]) for use with [param parameters]. The optional [param parameters] array provides positional parameters to substitute into placeholders using Godot's format strings. The optional [param attributes] dictionary adds structured metadata to the log entry. Structured attributes support [code]bool[/code], [code]int[/code], [code]float[/code], and [code]String[/code] data types. Other types will be converted to strings. [codeblock] # Simple usage SentrySDK.logger.info("Player Alice joined lobby with 3 players")
# With parameters and attributes SentrySDK.logger.info("Player %s joined lobby with %d players", ["Alice", 3], { "lobby_id": "lobby_456", "player_count": 3 }) [/codeblock]

method.name: log
method.description:
Logs a message with the specified log level to Sentry. This is the base logging method used by all other level-specific methods. The [param level] specifies the log level from [enum SentryLog.LogLevel] (e.g., [constant SentryLog.LOG_LEVEL_INFO], [constant SentryLog.LOG_LEVEL_ERROR]). The [param body] is the main log message and can contain format placeholders (e.g., [code]%s[/code], [code]%d[/code]) for use with [param parameters]. The optional [param parameters] array provides positional parameters to substitute into placeholders using Godot's format strings. The optional [param attributes] dictionary adds structured metadata to the log entry. Structured attributes support [code]bool[/code], [code]int[/code], [code]float[/code], and [code]String[/code] data types. Other types will be converted to strings. [codeblock] # Simple usage SentrySDK.logger.log(SentryLog.LOG_LEVEL_WARN, "Performance warning: frame time exceeded 16 ms")
# With parameters and attributes SentrySDK.logger.log(SentryLog.LOG_LEVEL_WARN, "Performance warning: %s exceeded %d ms", ["frame time", 16], { "actual_time": "25ms", "target_fps": 60 }) [/codeblock]

method.name: trace
method.description:
Logs a trace message to Sentry. Trace logs are used for detailed debugging and flow tracking, typically disabled in production. The [param body] is the main log message and can contain format placeholders (e.g., [code]%s[/code], [code]%d[/code]) for use with [param parameters]. The optional [param parameters] array provides positional parameters to substitute into placeholders using Godot's format strings. The optional [param attributes] dictionary adds structured metadata to the log entry. Structured attributes support [code]bool[/code], [code]int[/code], [code]float[/code], and [code]String[/code] data types. Other types will be converted to strings. [codeblock] # Simple usage SentrySDK.logger.trace("AI behavior tree evaluated with 8 nodes")
# With parameters and attributes SentrySDK.logger.trace("AI %s evaluated with %d nodes", ["behavior tree", 8], { "ai_id": "enemy_boss", "decision": "attack" }) [/codeblock]

method.name: warn
method.description:
Logs a warning message to Sentry. Warning logs indicate potential issues that don't prevent operation but should be addressed. The [param body] is the main log message and can contain format placeholders (e.g., [code]%s[/code], [code]%d[/code]) for use with [param parameters]. The optional [param parameters] array provides values to substitute into placeholders using Godot's format strings. The optional [param attributes] dictionary adds structured metadata to the log entry. Structured attributes support [code]bool[/code], [code]int[/code], [code]float[/code], and [code]String[/code] data types. Other types will be converted to strings. [codeblock] # Simple usage SentrySDK.logger.warn("Low ammo warning: pistol has 2 bullets remaining")
# With parameters and attributes SentrySDK.logger.warn("Low ammo warning: %s has %d bullets remaining", ["pistol", 2], { "weapon_id": "pistol_001", "max_capacity": 15 }) [/codeblock]
